topics.body: I love the Flea Market. Something about the aura and the crowd of people all shopping in one place just gets my blood going. It's not as sterile and clean as a mall but it isn't dinghy or grimy either. It hits that perfect balance. It's essentially a modern day bazaar.

"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5535c2e36368720d89190800#post_5535c2e36368720d89190800
Heh. ^^ well if you have a burning passion for a certain thing then you go all the way out.

I think the only CV games I don't like are the Lords of Shadow games.
Heck, I'd play 64 over those games.

I think my faves are Rondo of Blood, Super Castlevania IV, Bloodlines, Aria of Sorrow, Dawn of Sorrow, Symphony of The Night, Harmony of Dissonance and the japanese version of Castlevania 3. Actually, scratch that, most are my favorites. I don't even consider the second one a bad game. Flawed, yes, but not terrible.

Yeah the lords of shadows games...aren't great. Even if you ignore the fact that they're castlevania and just play them as their own series they're still not very good. 

Also, I can understand liking 2. It's sort of like how zelda 2 was drastically different because nobody really knew how to make a sequel back then. 


Also I've never played many of the symphony/metroidvania style games. In fact I think symphony is the only one I have played.
